 Here's what Madison thought from his own pen:
 

 Madison Wrote in a letter to then Gov of Virginia, Henry Lee " What think you of the commentary....on the terms 'general welfare'? -- The Federal government has been hitherto limited to the specific powers, by the Greatest Champions of Latitude in expounding those powers --If not only the means, but the objects are unlimited, the parchment had better be thrown into the fire at once"
 Letter Madison to Henry Lee, Phila. Jan. 1, 1792
 
 and
 
 "if Congress can do whatever in their discretion can be done by money, and will promote the general welfare, the government is no longer one possessing enumerated powers, but an indefinite one subject to particular exceptions."
 Madison to Edmund Pendleton, Jan 21, 1792, Phila.
